actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act of 1959 to provide that elections of officers of intermediate bodies of labor organizations may be by officers representative of the members in good standing only if any officer representative of less than 50 members is entitled to one vote and any officer representative of more than 50 members is entitled to one additional vote for every additional 50 members.

summary.text: Provides, under the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act, that elections of officers of intermediate bodies of labor organizations may be by officers representative of the members in good standing only if any officer representative of less than 50 members is entitled to one vote and any officer representative of more than 50 members is entitled to one additional vote for every additional 50 members.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act of 1959 to provide that elections of officers of intermediate bodies of labor organizations may be by officers representative of the members in good standing only if any officer representative of less than 50 members is entitled to one vote and any officer representative of more than 50 members is entitled to one additional vote for every additional 50 members.
